a1: EXIF (Exchangeable Image File Format) is metadata embedded in image files by digital cameras and smartphones. It includes information like camera model, date taken, exposure settings, and sometimes GPS location.
q2: Which file formats contain EXIF data?
a2: JPEG and TIFF files commonly contain EXIF data. PNG files typically do not store EXIF metadata.
q3: Is my image uploaded to a server?
a3: No, all processing happens entirely in your browser. Your images never leave your device.
q4: Can I remove EXIF data from my photos?
a4: This tool only reads EXIF data. To remove it, you can use image editing software or take a screenshot of the image.
